review: Came with my granddaughter to get my free birthday burger.  It was awesome, burger was cooked just right. She had the mac and cheese and said it was very good. Our server was fast and friendly, he brought her another lemonade almost as soon as she finished the 1st one. And as always the steak fries are great. I really enjoy coming here for lunch. Have never had a complaint about service or the food.

Never bad service and food is always good. A little overpriced for a burger and fries, but still tasty. I miss the old menu and the old decor, but some of the changes are welcome ones. Burning Love burger is a favorite if you like spicy food, and still some of the best side sauce around.

Service on this visit was excellent which really surprised me.  It has never been this good in the past.   Our order was delivered timely and the food was good.  The bottomless fries and vegetables are always appreciated.

I have been to a couple other Red Robin places before and always had excellent food and service, today was not the case here. My fries had a hair in them and I politely sent them back and the meal was promptly remade. I never received so much as an apology for our inconvenience and I felt like I was swept under the rug. Like nobody really cares about the hair in my food or the soggy fries they kept sending out to me. I understand mistakes happen but it could have been handled better. Will not be returning.
Food was mediocre but service was really terrible. We got no refils on drinks or their so called bottomless fries. We won't be returning.

My friend and I met here at noon for lunch.  The lunch crowd hadn't descended so we were greeted and seated right away.  I was concerned that at this time of day we would have a wait and terrible service based on other reviews but I'm happy to say that wasn't the case. Our server Tyler was friendly, and attentive without being a pest.  I ordered the Sir Acha double tavern burger. I wasn't asked how I'd like the burger cooked but it arrived with only minimal pink and was cooked to my liking.  I was all about the fries today and was really concerned I was gonna have a long wait on refills.  They were very quick in getting another basket out to me.   My friend ordered the Avo Cobb O salad, which she enjoyed except for the bacon pieces in it which she said were too tough.  She also ordered a Raspberry tea which she said wasn't sweet enough and had a strange taste.   That didn't keep her from having a refill however :) All in all we had a great lunch, excellent service and we will be back.

I treated my family out to dinner this past weekend which is a rare treat as my sister is in a wheelchair and outings are not easy. I want to thank the hosts and our kind server (Jake? Jacob? Sorry I can't remember his name) for their amazing service! The hosts moved chairs and tables to make room for her chair and made us feel very comfortable. It wasn't my first time at this establishment but I was very impressed with the service this particular day. Will be back!

The atmosphere here is the same as all Red Robins. Which includes a lot of red. It is actually very nice inside.  I ordered the Very Berry Raspberry Limeade ($4). A 1/2 order of Boneless Wings: whiskey bbq sauce ($5). The Southern Charm Burger ($14). And lastly a Chocolate Shake ($4). The Limeade was very tasty and was bottomless so there were many refills. The wings also were very good and came with onion strings and chips, however they were very small, and I do mean very small. I've never seen boneless wings anywhere near that small. The southern charm burger was very good, probably the best part of meal but wow is it pricey. The burger consists of 1 patty glazed with brown sugar, topped with candied bacon, honey bbq sauce, sharp cheddar cheese, with caramelized onions, on a toasted ciabatta bun. The candied bacon was extremely good and the bun was perfect. The only negative was it felt too small, I really liked it but wish it was a little bigger. The burger comes with bottomless steak fries which are ok but nothing special. Lastly the shake was good with no complaints.  The waitress was very friendly and helpful.  Overall I give it 4 stars. The food was good, but small and pricey. The service was good, but long wait times for the food during a slow period. Will I be back? Yes, but not regularly!

Very meh. Server was nice and made a good drink recommendation, but my burger was not what I was expecting when I read "gourmet burgers".  It was very small and although it tasted alright did not live up to the expectation. Our extra side salads that we ordered did not come out before our meal while we watched them sit in the window for a solid 10-15 minutes before coming out with our burgers. What really bothered me though was the lack of pre-bussing done on the table. My first bar drink that I finished was on the table until the end of the meal. Normally this wouldn't be a problem, but our table was a small two top with not much room to begin with. And we were RIGHT next to the server station/ kitchen which was very noisy, but I get sections and everything so I wasn't going to complain about that. Overall it wasn't a very memorable meal.

This was our first time at a Red Robin. They were busy when we got there. Not too long of a wait for a Friday night (20-25 min).  I ordered the fish and shrimp dinner. My husband ordered a chicken wrap. My son ordered a bacon cheeseburger and my daughter ordered the mini corn dogs and fruit. Two orders of fries came right away but then after that the service got slow. Our waitress would walk pass our table a few times before she picked up any empty dishes on the table. It took them a long time to get my daughter's endless fruit. She would have ate more had they not been so slow. They were just really small condiment bowls so I'm not sure why it took forever. After we ate she never picked up our empty plates. We ordered dessert and they dropped it off but didn't clear any of our dinner plates so we didn't have much room. We asked for a to go box and that took forever to get as well. The table behind us had to put their coats on to give the waitress a hint that they wanted their bill. They did not seem short staffed- there were lots of them around. They just didn't seem too fast.  Just walking around doing nothing. Not using their time wisely. Management really needs to work in this.
Service is horrible! Also, their "bottomless fries" is a lie....We had to ask 5 Times to get one order of fries. Avoid at all costs!

I've never had a "great" experience at Red Robin, but it's been acceptable in the past.  Last night will be our last visit, though; there are plenty of places to get a good burger around Grand Rapids. The food was good, but the service was non-existent.  We saw our server 3 times, and the last two were when we flagged her down.  "Unlimited" fries only works when someone stops by your table and asks if you'd like more fries.  By the time flagged her down to get our bill, we were running late and getting very frustrated.

My wife and I are regulars at this restaurant.  All of the managers know us by face if not by name.  We're comfortable here, so it suits us. Service is typically excellent.  Food is almost always done right.  There really is nothing to complain about in our opinion.  My wife and I are both Royalty Club members so we do get discounts and free burgers on occasion. My wife normally gets the Bacon Cheeseburger well done and I normally get the Royal medium or medium well.

Our waitress was nice but clueless.  We were seated immediately and it took an hour and a half to get our food.  My husband asked for them to change the tv station to watch the Tigers game the manager said he would change the station and never did! It was the least they could do considering our food was over cooked but cold.

Today, I had the nacho crunch tavern double burger was delicious.The service was great from the start. Our waiter was very attentive and asked all questions during dinning time. We had our unlimited fries! I would return to this location.

Bad experience today.. Ordered burger medium well and I got blood and dark pink.. Server did not reduce bill.. I didn't notice until a few bites in because the lighting is odd at the table I was at.. Of course I felt sick after seeing it..
Excellent burger! Cold sweet potato fries delivered. Manager brought a double serving of piping hot sweet potato fries.  The server, Sarah, was fabulous. Great job Sarah, thank you!!

One of my favorite burger joints. I love their whiskey river burger, absolutely delicious and my go to. They do bottomless fries with the burgers, but it was like pulling teeth to get our server to bring additional orders. Besides the neglect, the food was awesome and the burgers were made to order. Would definitely go again!

Very good food, the only issue I have is they the "bottomless" fries that the last few times my wife and I have gone are far from bottomless (if we even get any). We sit waiting for fries while 5 different managers just walked by us and in the booth next to us 2 managers where doing an employee review which was interesting to listen to. Think the place has gotten comforable and are not looking to keep that great customer service they had at the beginning.

My husband and I used to come here quite a bit...we won't be back. Our server was training someone and when the server(in training) wasn't at the table our server talked down about her...made us Very uncomfortable. The server in training was doing a great job!  We both got burgers....so not worth asking how we would like it cooked when it comes out well done. The burgers didn't have the burst of flavor I was looking for...just barbeque on a bun.

Red Robin has pretty good burgers. I like the  bottomless fries. Those are perfect for kids while waiting for the food. The restaurant is always clean,  the wait staff is good at making sure you're not out of drinks. I would recommend this place.

"And the red, red robin goes bob, bob, bobbin' along." I have this fantasy of using song lyrics in all my reviews, but I know it's never gonna happen. Ahem, I digress.  Did I really just drive 80 miles to eat at Red Robin? My odometer says yes. And okay, it was my mother-in-law who chose tonight's dining destination, and her palate consists of all things chain restaurant and not much else. Not that there's anything wrong with that. I like Red Robin.  I like Red Robin, however, for the wrong reasons. I love the jalapeño coin appetizer. I love their stupid bottomless stunt drinks like Freckled Lemonade and Melonade which tastes a whole lot less skin cancery than it sounds. And I totally love the unlimited, never ending  steak fries and "Campfire" dipping sauce, which tastes like a holy combination of barbecue and ranch. As I've said before, potatoes make me happy and infinite amounts of them provide for endless happiness. Somewhere out there there's a shrink about to say that Food should not provide happiness. Or that I'm compensating for something or...blah, blah, blah...Fudge off.  I dream about those fries.  In other news, I totally think their burgers are overpriced and overrated. They're way too small for the price you pay, and they mask the lame quality of beef with all the crap they pile on top. I can never figure out which one I want, and usually end up with a meh one.  Service was super friendly and attentive, plus she anticipated our needs so that's a definite plus. Rock on, Robin.

Good, flavorful, food but not worth the price.  You get "bottomless" fries but you don't get many in a basket *that you're sharing family style), then your waiting for someone to come around so you can ask for more. We were able to get a refill though. It's not that staff was lazy or anything; they were actually quite friendly.  I thinks it's just that they were too busy and trying to keep up.  Loud environment, could hardly hear each other at the table. Although I probably won't be back (price), I say A-OK because the food was good and staff was friendly.  :)

This restaurant was a very a-typical franchise experience. I got the Garden Burger that was average, with the sweet potato fries which were super salty. My mom got a borderline inedible pasta dish. BUT, with that being said, our waitress was superb and handled the situation with poise and grace. She offered her a different dish of her choice and had me fresh fries made. Overall, I would say this is a very average visit to a franchised restaurant.

The food is a little pricy, but it's consistently good.  My favorite is the gourmet cheeseburger, with bleu cheese and extra pickle. With a bottomless freckled lemonade to drink, I fill up on fruit before my burger even arrives. Their chicken is good too, the onion rings and cheese sticks are great. Once we had an order of cheese sticks that were still frozen, we sent them back and they gave them back hot, and free.  It is loud, it's almost as if they're playing pure noise along with the music. The servers are usually polite, we've only ever had one bad server and that was at the Woodland location.  It's a once and awhile place to go, but I've never had a terrible experience here. It's worth stopping in once for the bottomless fries and a cherry limeaid.

I've been to this Red Robin a couple times along with the location by Woodland Mall. The other reviewers on this location are right. The food is overpriced. However, any claims that the food is bland are incorrect in my opinion. I think that the food is pretty fantastic depending on what you order. The portions are huge. It's not the healthiest fare you could eat, obviously, but you're not going here to loose weight. Overall, I've had good experiences at this location. I'd recommend it for those special occasions you want to treat yourself and have the extra cash to do it. I wouldn't go here often, simply based on price.

We love going to Red Robin and our boys love it too.    Our very first time there we had trouble with a waitress who delivered a hot appetizer right over the head of our (at that time) 1 year old and set it in front of him.  We had to pitch a fit.  But we gave them another chance and we've been happy ever since. The endless Steak Fries are a huge hit with all of us.    We're on a budget so going to Red Robin is a rare treat - don't expect to get out of there for less than $40 for a family of four.

Very nice  place.  We were visiting  the area overnight and enjoyed our stay.  Fast service and great atmosphere.   We  had the Chop House Burger.  Good stuff.  Onions were a tad greasy though. Had the fries which were good.   FUN TIME.  Really don't think the money is bad for the food you get.

Red robin used to be our go to place whenever we knew there was one on the area. In the past year they have dramatically changed the menu and raised their prices. Burgers, which used to be the proud star of this show, have since been buried in the back of the menu. Now foods that are highlighted don't seem to make sense at all for what red robin built their reputation on. Now it's grilled chicken topped with a sauce or even pasta. For their part the wait stuff did a magnificent job and all drinks did not even drop below 1/2 full before they filled them. I bought the prime rib French dip. The prime rib was much tougher than most roast beefs and the au jus was warm water. Steak fries are still bottomless, although 5 served at a time. The sandwich also came with cole slaw, which was cabbage and mayonnaise. And all this for the low low price of 11.99 for the sandwich. What a disappointment. Seems red robin is going through a bit of a personality disorder and I hope they get their act together soon because I won't be back until they do.

This was my worst experience ever at a Red Robin.  The $8 margarita was obviously missing the main ingredient:  tequilla.  The drink was the worst margarita I ever had.  The turkey burger was tasty, but gave me indigestion.  The endless supply of fries stopped coming at the second serving.  My husband's salad was mediocre at best.  Will not be visiting this Red Robin again.

their "bottomless fries" is a joke. you get about 10 fries in a basket and they give you one for every two people. they barley come around to give you more. should defiantly be ran differently, but all and all it's good. the food is good and they have good drinks and sauces. my favorite is camp fire sauce!

Red Robin is one of my favorite places to eat.  All my experiences there have been great.  Food wise, I have to suggest the Banzai Burger.  Simply amazing.  And the fries are great! Last summer I had my brithday celebration at Red Robin, and it was the best decision I ever made.  I had about 18 people there.  They had all of orders correct... all of our drinks constantly refilled... and they were super friendly and nice because it was my birthday.  To top it all off... they had all 18 of us fed, checked out and paid for in less than an hour!  It was AMAZING.  Definitely good for big groups.

I visited this location on a Sunday evening around five o'clock.The restaurant was clean and the semi open kitchen looked organized. The wait staff was friendly enough and our food was delivered quickly, so much in fact that I felt like I was being rushed. We were not asked if we would like anything for desert the check was simply presented the third time by the table while with a(finishing up here?) The shroom burger was tasty and well cooked although a little awkward to eat being presented half wrapped in a little basket.  No room to set the burger down and what do you do with the wrapper when you are done? Wad it up and try to eat your fries? Which were quite tasty and well cooked. I would recommend the freckled lemonade if you do eat here,the chunky strawberries go great with the tangy lemonade. Prices are high for the food, gourmet in your name or not $10.00 for a hamburg splashed with a couple fries is a little much.
Best RR experience out of all the store's I've been to. Friendly staff, great service, great food.

Okay, there are a lot of things I would like to say bout this particular restaurant and the corporation as a whole, bother from the perspective of an ex-employee and a guest. Firstly, the food is incredible.  And they cater to all taste with the option to modify any burger on their menu any way you'd like to.  That includes substituting a Gardenburger, Boca burger, and other vegetarian meats on any of their sandwiches.  In addition to which they offer foods like salads, wraps, soups, ribs, pastas, fajitas, and others.  It makes for a rather diverse group to choose from. But when you start taking into account the fact that a soda costs $2.19, and any of their specialty non-alcoholic drinks are $4+, the bill, at what would seemingly be a pretty cheap-type check starts to sky rocket.  Their redemption is the bottomless steak fries, but in reality, after eating a $1o burger no one really wants more. So on the whole its a good experience.  The staff are energetic, the atmosphere is a fun one, that includes all generations, and the food is fantastic.  Probably not my first choice, but definitely not my last.

got myself a burnin love burger and the bottomless fries are a huge plus. the strawberry speckled lemonade is always a pleasure but the usually attentive staff definitely make eating here fairly painless...now only if i could manage to eat healthy here...

The few times I've been there it was always mediocre. The burgers were dry and over priced. They throw a lot of toppings on them to cover up the boring meat. I've had better burgers at bars. There is a lot of hoopla going on to get you in the mood to have fun. Again I think it is just cover for boring food. If you had a good time you will come back. Based on food I'd never pay for it.

We always stop here on our way home from Silver Lake.  We've always had great food and good service.  The only thing lacking was our drink refills.  Everytime we go, we're always thirsty halfway through our meal beause we never get our drinks filled.  Other than that - great place!  Their burgers are amazing!!!

This place is ok, tend to only go on special occasions because I feel the food is overpriced. We were there last on 11/29 to celebrate my daughter's 10th birthday. We had an awesome waiter who made sure that our onion ring order was in before their "happy hour" was over (he only had 2 minutes to do it). I enjoyed the fajitas I ordered, my husband had a chicken sandwich that was good, my 10 year old ate the children's spaghetti (which she loves) and my other daughter had a burger. Would give a higher rating if we just didn't have pay so much!

I went here for a friend's birthday celebration. The food was good, but not great. The burgers are huge, so if you are not super hungry, I would opt for the kids hamburger. The staff was very fun and we had great service from our waiter. When she found out it was my friend's birthday, our waiter brought here a free hot fudge sundae and the whole staff sang her happy birthday, Red Robin style. The atmosphere is loud and energetic, a very fun place to have dinner especially if you love burgers and fries.
